result.markdown:
--- title: "" --- # Teste *in vivo* ## Pacotes ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(readxl) library(DT) library(tidyverse) library(ggthemes) library(dplyr) library(DHARMa) library(performance) library(emmeans) library(multcomp) library(epifitter) library(tidyverse) library(agricolae) library(patchwork) ``` ::: ## Severidade ### Importando dados ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sev <- read_xlsx("dados_in_vivo.xlsx", 3) datatable(sev) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ### Vizualização dos dados ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sev2 <- sev|> group_by(trat, tempo) |> summarise(severidade_mean = mean(severidade)) sev2 |> ggplot(aes(tempo, severidade_mean, color = factor(trat)))+ geom_point() + geom_line(size = 0.8)+ scale_x_continuous(limits = c(48,192), breaks = seq(48,192,48))+ scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0,100), breaks = seq(0,100,10))+ theme_few()+ labs(x = "hai", y = "Severidade (%)", color = "")+ scale_color_few() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](invivo_2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### ANOVA ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sev$tempo <- as.factor(sev$tempo) sev3 <- sev |> filter(tempo == "192") modelo1 <- lm(severidade ~ trat, data = sev3) anova(modelo1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Analysis of Variance Table Response: severidade Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F) trat 2 9762.8 4881.4 192.96 3.044e-14 *** Residuals 21 531.2 25.3 --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sev3 |> ggplot(aes(x = factor(trat, levels = c("NPsAg", "NPsCu", "Controle")), y = severidade)) + geom_boxplot(fill = "gray90", outlier.color = NA) + geom_jitter(width = 0.1, height = 1, color = "black", size = 1.1) + geom_point(stat = "summary", fun = "mean", shape = 20, size = 3.2 , color = "red") + scale_y_continuous(limits = c(30, 100), n.breaks = 5) + theme_few()+ labs(x= "", y= "Severidade (%)") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](invivo_2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: #### Teste de normalidade e homogeneidade ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(simulateResiduals(modelo1)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](invivo_2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} check_normality(modelo1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.406). ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} check_heteroscedasticity(modelo1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.127). ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} hist(modelo1$residuals) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](invivo_2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: #### Comparação das médias ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} emmeans <- emmeans(modelo1, ~trat) cld(emmeans, Letters = letters) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` trat emmean SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group NPsAg 35.5 1.78 21 31.8 39.1 a NPsCu 53.0 1.78 21 49.3 56.7 b Controle 84.2 1.78 21 80.5 87.9 c Confidence level used: 0.95 P value adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 3 estimates significance level used: alpha = 0.05 NOTE: If two or more means share the same grouping symbol, then we cannot show them to be different. But we also did not show them to be the same. ``` ::: ::: ## AACPD ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data_sev <- read_xlsx("dados_in_vivo.xlsx", 3) data_sev$tempo <- as.numeric(as.character(data_sev$tempo)) a1 <- data_sev |> group_by(trat, rep) |> summarise(aacpd = AUDPC(tempo, severidade)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` `summarise()` has grouped output by 'trat'. You can override using the `.groups` argument. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} a1 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 24 × 3 # Groups: trat [3] trat rep aacpd 1 Controle 1 5482. 2 Controle 2 6576 3 Controle 3 4472. 4 Controle 4 5107. 5 Controle 5 5358 6 Controle 6 5290. 7 Controle 7 5335. 8 Controle 8 5405. 9 NPsAg 1 2577. 10 NPsAg 2 3198 # ℹ 14 more rows ``` ::: ::: ### Visualizar a AACPD ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} a1 |> ggplot(aes(trat, aacpd)) + geom_boxplot() + labs(x = "Tratamento", y = "AACPD") + theme_few() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](invivo_2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: #### ANOVA ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} m_a1 <- lm(aacpd ~ trat + factor(rep), data = a1) anova(m_a1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Analysis of Variance Table Response: aacpd Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F) trat 2 27468502 13734251 125.8051 1.13e-09 *** factor(rep) 7 1594344 227763 2.0863 0.1144 Residuals 14 1528393 109171 --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 ``` ::: ::: #### Teste de normalidade e homogeneidade ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(simulateResiduals(m_a1)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](invivo_2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} check_normality(m_a1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.543). ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} check_heteroscedasticity(m_a1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.066). ``` ::: ::: #### Comparação das médias ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} media <- emmeans(m_a1, ~trat) cld(media, Letters = letters) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` trat emmean SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group NPsAg 2820 117 14 2569 3070 a NPsCu 3608 117 14 3358 3859 b Controle 5378 117 14 5128 5629 c Results are averaged over the levels of: rep Confidence level used: 0.95 P value adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 3 estimates significance level used: alpha = 0.05 NOTE: If two or more means share the same grouping symbol, then we cannot show them to be different. But we also did not show them to be the same. ``` ::: ::: ## Pigmentos #### Importando os dados ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} pig <- read_xlsx("dados_in_vivo.xlsx", 2) datatable(pig) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: #### Visualização dos dados ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} chl1 <- pig |> ggplot(aes(x = factor(trat, levels = c("NPsAg", "NPsCu", "Controle")), y = clorofila))+ geom_point()+ scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0,4), breaks = seq(0,4,1)) + theme_few() + labs(x = "Tratamento", y = "Chl a+b (mg/g FW)", color ="") chl1 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](invivo_2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} car1 <- pig |> ggplot(aes(x = factor(trat, levels = c("NPsAg", "NPsCu", "Controle")), y = carotenoides))+ geom_point()+ scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0,0.5), breaks = seq(0,0.5,0.1)) + theme_few() + labs(x = "Tratamento", y = "Carotenoides (mg/g FW)", color ="") car1 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](invivo_2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-2.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} (chl1|car1) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](invivo_2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-3.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Clorofila ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} lm_chl <- lm(clorofila ~ trat, data = pig) anova(lm_chl) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Analysis of Variance Table Response: clorofila Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F) trat 2 6.5396 3.2698 117.71 3.884e-12 *** Residuals 21 0.5833 0.0278 --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 ``` ::: ::: #### Teste normalidade e homogeneidade ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(simulateResiduals(lm_chl)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](invivo_2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} check_normality(lm_chl) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.120). ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} check_heteroscedasticity(lm_chl) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.996). ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} hist(lm_chl$residuals) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](invivo_2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-19-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: #### Comparação das médias ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} media_chl <- emmeans(lm_chl, ~trat) cld(media_chl, Letters = letters) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` trat emmean SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group Controle 1.79 0.0589 21 1.67 1.91 a NPsCu 2.09 0.0589 21 1.97 2.22 b NPsAg 3.02 0.0589 21 2.89 3.14 c Confidence level used: 0.95 P value adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 3 estimates significance level used: alpha = 0.05 NOTE: If two or more means share the same grouping symbol, then we cannot show them to be different. But we also did not show them to be the same. ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} chl2 <- pig |> group_by(trat) |> summarise(clorofila_mean = mean(clorofila), clorofila_sd = sd(clorofila)) |> ggplot(aes(x = factor(trat, levels = c("NPsAg", "NPsCu", "Controle")), y = clorofila_mean)) + geom_point()+ scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0,4), breaks = seq(0,4,1)) + geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = clorofila_mean - clorofila_sd, ymax = clorofila_mean + clorofila_sd, width = 0.05))+ theme_few() + labs(x = "Tratamento", y = "Chl a+b (mg/g FW)", color ="") + annotate("text", x= 1, y= 3.4, label = "a") + annotate("text", x= 2, y= 2.5, label = "b") + annotate("text", x= 3, y= 2.1, label = "c") chl2 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](invivo_2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-21-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Carotenoides ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} lm_car <- lm(carotenoides ~ trat, data = pig) anova(lm_car) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Analysis of Variance Table Response: carotenoides Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F) trat 2 0.042233 0.0211167 50.68 9.185e-09 *** Residuals 21 0.008750 0.0004167 --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 ``` ::: ::: #### Testando normalidade e homogeneidade ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(simulateResiduals(lm_car)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](invivo_2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-23-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} check_normality(lm_car) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.209). ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} check_heteroscedasticity(lm_car) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.798). ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} hist(lm_car$residuals) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](invivo_2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: #### Comparando as médias ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} media_car <- emmeans(lm_car, ~trat) cld(media_car, Letters = letters) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` trat emmean SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group Controle 0.285 0.00722 21 0.270 0.300 a NPsCu 0.370 0.00722 21 0.355 0.385 b NPsAg 0.378 0.00722 21 0.362 0.393 b Confidence level used: 0.95 P value adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 3 estimates significance level used: alpha = 0.05 NOTE: If two or more means share the same grouping symbol, then we cannot show them to be different. But we also did not show them to be the same. ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} car2 <- pig |> group_by(trat) |> summarise(carotenoides_mean = mean(carotenoides), carotenoides_sd = sd(carotenoides)) |> ggplot(aes(x = factor(trat, levels = c("NPsAg", "NPsCu", "Controle")), y = carotenoides_mean)) + geom_point()+ scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0,0.5), breaks = seq(0,0.5,0.1)) + geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = carotenoides_mean - carotenoides_sd, ymax = carotenoides_mean + carotenoides_sd, width = 0.05))+ theme_few() + labs(x = "Tratamento", y = "Chl a+b (mg/g FW)", color ="") + annotate("text", x= 1, y= 0.42, label = "a") + annotate("text", x= 2, y= 0.41, label = "a") + annotate("text", x= 3, y= 0.33, label = "b") car2 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](invivo_2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-26-1.png){width=672} ::: :::
